headline: Pinterest, Super Micro Computer, James Hardie Industries: Market Minute
summary: Here are some of the biggest stock stories for Monday, March 24. Pinterest (PINS) shares received an upgrade to Buy from Neutral at Guggenheim, while Super Micro Computer (SMCI) was downgraded to Sell from Neutral at Goldman Sachs. Shares of James Hardie Industries (JHX) are falling after it agreed to by Azek (AZEK) for nearly $9 billion. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

headline: Super Micro Computer downgraded to Sell by Goldman Sachs
summary: Super Micro Computer (SMCI) was downgraded by Goldman Sachs (GS) from Neutral to Sell, citing valuation, competition, and margins as downside risks. Threadneedle Ventures founder Ann Berry joins Catalysts host Madison Mills to break down the analyst note. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Catalysts here.

headline: Tech stocks, crypto stocks, Super Micro Computer: Market Minute
summary: Yahoo Finance anchor Madison Mills examines the top stories kicking off Monday's trading day as part of today's Market Minute. Tech stocks, including Nvidia (NVDA), Advanced Micro Devices (AMD), and Meta Platforms (META), are rising amid the broader market rally on expectations that President Trump may soften his approach to anticipated tariffs. Crypto stocks, such as Coinbase (COIN), Strategy (MSTR), and Robinhood (HOOD), are seeing gains from bitcoin's (BTC=F) climb to the upside. Super Micro Computer (SMCI) is under pressure after Goldman Sachs (GS) downgraded the stock to Sell from Neutral and cut its price target to $32 from $40. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

headline: Insider Picks For High Growth Companies In March 2025
summary: As the U.S. stock market experiences a rebound with the S&P 500 and Nasdaq snapping their four-week losing streaks, investors are keenly observing how big tech influences these indices amidst ongoing economic uncertainties. In this environment, growth companies with high insider ownership can present intriguing opportunities, as insider stakes often signal confidence in a company's long-term potential despite short-term market fluctuations.
